alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 10:00PM EDT until April 10 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... White River at Edwardsport, Hazleton, and Petersburg. Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Riverton, and Mount Carmel. .Lowland, minor flooding continues along lower portions of the Wabash and White Rivers. With dry weather expected for at least several days, the existing flooding is expected to end over the weekend for most locations, but continue until Tuesday next week at Mount Carmel, and near the end of next week at Hazleton. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Flooding closes Old Vincennes Road. High water crosses SR 358 on the Daviess County side just west of the levee. Flooding begins to affect higher bottomlands. Residential property of river cabins begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Friday /6:00 PM CDT Friday/ the stage was 16.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EDT Friday /6:00 PM CDT Friday/ was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
